messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 41 years old, female, of Black or African American descent. You have college graduate and an annual income of $90,000 or more. Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I feel very confident in the ability to obtain,and process information about my basic health information . I know the right questions to ask .
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my doctorbecause I think he will always be truthful about my health . I feel I can feel free to ask anything whatsoever I am concerned about pertaining to my health and get a honest answer.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I have felt nervous about women's issues and how to handle them . I have also been nervous when waiting to see about test results since I do not know what the results may be .
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I had pain in my chest ,I had this before so I went in to be checked realizing that I could potentially have a clot . It turned out I did not . I at least followed my doctor's advice to go be seen right away because of past clots.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I feel I am well equipped to make informative health decisions. I am also very inclined to look into anything I do not understand further using online resources, professionals, books etc.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my physician because she is open and honest with me; she explains everything before I even ask.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
What makes me feel most axioms is the prospect of being sick and the potential threat to my health, well being and life overall.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
When I was in college, I was able to help a friend diagnose a skin rash and other symptoms as an allergic reaction based on information I learned in an Immunology class.

English is their first language. You are 31.0 feet tall and weighs 180 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel that I have full capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions. If by any chance I do not understand the information given to me I would ask the necessary individuals who can assist me.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

The reason why I mostly trust my primary care physician is because he examines and explains all physical circumstances to the best of his knowledge. Every challenge I have encountered rendered very positive results thus far. Although I am also aware that my doctor is not perfect and is very capable to error. This is why it is important to research certain medical ailments on my own as well. Asking plenty of questions are always in order when it comes to my well being.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
The only way I will be anxious during a doctor visit is when the physical feeling in my body is overwhelmingly uncomfortable.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
Being diagnosed with a certain ailment, I am aware of certain side effects that can occur during the medication series.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 31 years old, female, of Asian descent. You have college graduate and an annual income of $75,000 - $89,999. English is their first language. You are 31.0 feet tall and weighs 121 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I think if given access to adequate and accurate information and allowed sufficient time to proceed this information, I should be able to gain a greater understanding of my medical condition and to be able to make better health decisions. Also, the opportunity to have my questions answered in a nonjudgmental way is also necessary to achieve this goal.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I am not sure if I completely trust my primary care physician because he seems more concerned about liability or convenience at times rather than in the welfare of the patient. He is not as open to answering questions about medical care. He also is not as uptodate on treatments and may recommend something that he is familiar with but may not be as effective as more new or modern treatments.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I am considered about my taste of health and an uneasy as to what new concerns might popup when visiting the doctor's office. I get worried about what the test results might show and am somewhat apprehensive about get the results back.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

One such experience was when I helped to take care of a loved one who was sick. I knew by taking her temperature that she could be monitored more closely for signs of infection. For example if her temperature was above 100, she would have a fever and needed medical care because she might become septic.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I do trust most things she tells me, but feel she does not take the time to be thorough in her assessments. She always seems to be in a great hurry to be done with the exam.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Weather I have gained too much weight and/or if my high cholesterol levels have increased so that she feels I need to be on a stronger medication.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I was told I needed a breast biopsy because of an abnormal mammogram, but I was not too worried because I know there are a lot of false findings. As I suspected the biopsy came back negative, but was told I have very dense breast tissue so I know that it is imperative that I regularly have a mammogram.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 34 years old, female, of White descent. You have college graduate and an annual income of $90,000 or more. English is their first language. You are 31.0 feet tall and weighs 168 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel fairly confident that when I see medical professiols, I am getting the information I need specific to my situation. If there are areas I am unclear on, I try to ask questions to help myself understand. Thankfully I have the ability to contact them after the fact if there is something I didn't have fully explained while at an appointment.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

Typically when I see a doctor, they are a medical resident. I actually feel more confident in this situation because I know that if there is any doubt, they will seek more information through their attending. I would say I usually trust the doctors I see, but I do like to keep myself informed by other means as well, just in case.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
The thing that makes me most anxious is wondering if there will be something majorly wrong. I also worry that there won't be anything that can be done for symptoms that may be present.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I studied athletic training in college, and I've found that useful in emergent situations throughout life. If someone falls and cuts themselves or breaks something, I am confident enough to do what needs to be done immediately and then decide if they need to seek further medical attention. I recently helped an older gentleman who had tripped, fallen, and split his head. I knew to limit mobility until help arrived, and I knew to watch for signs of concussion (i.e. vomiting, blackout). I was able to help limit the loss of blood while we waited for the ambulance and kept him comfortable.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 35 years old, female, of Asian descent. You have college graduate and an annual income of $55,000 - $74,999. English is their first language. You are 28.0 feet tall and weighs 160 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I think my ability to understand basic health information is above average.  I can do research online, and sometimes I have a basic idea of what needs to be done before I even go to the doctor. I nearly always understand what doctors and other health care workers tell me as long as I ask appropriate questions. The only time I don't understand health care information is when I am reading something that is overly technical.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I do believe my doctor is honest, thorough, and careful for the most part. I think sometimes time constrictions can force her to be a little less thorough, especially when it comes to explaining why she is choosing a certain treatment. At times, I have trouble trusting doctors because I don't understand how they know the treatment they have chosen will work.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I am worried that they will find out I have some horrible disease, or they will give me a medication that causes bad side effects.  I also worry about how much my medical treatments will cost.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I used to be a customer service worker at a gym.  My gym offered equipment orientations to people.  The people who did the equipment orientations were supposed to have training and/or credentials that I did not have.  One night there was an equipment orientation scheduled, and the only person who was supposed to present the information had to deal with another problem.  So I started the orientation and explained how to use the treadmill safely, despite not being "properly" trained.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my doctor to give me the most up to date information concerning my health and well being.She emails me when I need to keep up with my chronic condition appointments concerning my diabetes.I get frequent emails with my lab results and information that my doctor wishes to relay to me.

I worry when I go to see my doctor about my weight and how to handle it considering its something I havent really dealt with even though my doctor has given me the tools to deal with it.I worry about my lab results concerning my a1c results since they are a direct result of my diabetes health.

I have diabetes. I have been through several programs which include biological and medical classes.I completed my phlebotomy and medical laboratory assistant programs.I care for my parents which involves understanding their medical problems.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I generally trust my primary care physician because she has been with my family for many years. She took over a practice from another older physician that helped my mother and needed to retire.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Feeling anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office can be caused by apprehension. The possibility of sick people in the waiting room -- passing along their own illness is always a concern.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I cant say for sure that I have had an experience in my life that demonstrated my knowledge of health or medical issues. I prefer to trust my doctor and/or nurses that are available to demonstrate their knowledge.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel I could obtain basic health info and services pretty well except for my social anxiety that gets in the way. I am often too shy to call to make an appointment, when I'm in an appointment I often just want it over as fast as possible so I might not bring up all my concerns.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
My primary care physician keeps leaving and I haven't met the new one, but I think they are fine. I worry that I don't know what a patient is supposed to do.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I don't want to have to take my clothes off. Most of the time the basic rule of society is to avoid being ked in front of other people, it's hard to adjust to the idea that it's supposed to be normal to do for medical professiols.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
When I had a sore throat with white patches I knew to go to the doctor to find out if it was strep because untreated strep can cause problems later.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are 29 years old, female, of White descent. Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

To a great degree I have the capacity to obtain and understand. I graduated with a bachelor of science so I am familiar with technical information. Anything I don't understand, I can research on the internet.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I distrust my primary care physician because she is always in a rush and in a hurry and basically often ignores what I am concerned about by brushing it off as no big deal. She often pushes medications as well when I make it clear that I do not want to use medicine as a first resort.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I am anxious that my doctor will criticize my lifestyle or my habits without seeing me as a person. I am worried that my doctor will not listen to me. I am worried that something will be wrong with me.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I had very infrequent periods but I knew that I was not pregnt. I looked online and saw I had many of the other symptoms of PCOS as well so I went to the gynecologist and expressed my concerns. It turns out I did have PCOS.
